_header: While men have their barns full
_description: The carol of Jak Rekles — four quatrains (aaab) and burden: ‘Ay ay be þis day / ȝ wyll mak mery qwyll y may’

CamStJohn259.First Lines:
Qwyll mene haue her bornys fullþerof y thynk my
                    part to pull…
CamStJohn259.Last Lines: …Now y red do aftyr mefor Iak rekles is my name
CamStJohn259.Editions:
James,  Montague Rhodes,  and  G. C. Macaulay, eds.  
             “Fifteenth Century Carols and Other Pieces.” 
             Modern Language Review
         8 (1913): 68-87: 80-1.
Greene,  Richard Leighton. 
             The Early English Carols.
         Oxford: Clarendon, 1935; 2nd ed., rev., Oxford: Clarendon,
            1977: 278; 1977, 246.
